lines.text: You still have it.
What?
My soul, for what it's worth.
I'm not a killer, Maggie, but this place makes me want to kill.
Grow up. Grow up! Stop living in the past and get your head into the future!

[Liam burned down Danny's gym]
What the hell did you think you were doing?
I saw you. I saw you with him.
[Glares at his mother]
You're going to run away with him, aren't you?

[Sits down next to him]
No. I'm gonna stay right here with you.
I don't want to see him ever again.
[Gets up and leaves]

[Seeing Danny for the first time in fourteen years]
You're out!

[after a pause]
Good behavior.

[Sarcastically]
You were never accused of that before.

[to Joe, her father]
My marriage was over before Liam was even born... I'm the prisoner here. You and your politics have made sure of that!
I do have a mind of my own, Danny. I know very well I might be losing it, but I do have a mind of my own.
You're a dangerous fucking woman, Maggie.
[last lines]
Where are you going?
We're going home.

[to Maggie]
I've lived with your face in silence for fourteen years. It's hard to talk to the real you.

[about the shootings disturbing the peace]
Last night didn't help. It didn't help.
We can't keep doing what we're doing, you know.
What are we doing?
That was a warning shot they fired at you.
For fourteen years I was locked up, my feelings were locked up inside me.
It's as though the Brits want this ceasefire to fail.
I'll leave if you ask me to.
If *I* ask you?

[to Maggie]
Give us a hug. You're a dangerous fuckin' woman!
I'm not a killer, Maggie. This place makes me want to kill.

[to Danny about Harry]
You did him a favor, and he'll never forgive you for it.

[to Danny as he is leaving]
Fourteen years not long enough for yuh?
